result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean J. Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MA]Cases 14CF203, 14CF239, 14CF319, 14CF323, 14CM163
Defendant Sean J. Mueller in court, in custody with Attorney Erika L Bierma.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Defendant's Motion to Modify Sentence:
--Arguments given by Attorney Bierma re: 'new factor', cites State v. Groeller
--Attorney Bierma requests that sentences for Cases 14CF239, 14CF319,14CF323 run concurrent to each other
--Statement made by Mr. Mueller

ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance 

--ADA Shock notifies Court that State has filed a written response to the motion 
--Arguments given by ADA Shock 
--Additional Argument given by Attorney Bierma 


This Court is not seeing a new factor that was not considered by Judge Weston at the time of sentencing.
The Court finds that the burden has not been met and denies the Defense's Motion to Modify Sentence. 

Attorney Bierma directs the Court to page 33 of the sentencing transcript, gives additional argument

The Court maintains its denial of the motion.

recess: 10:08am
State's reponse to defendant's motion to modify sentence
cc: DA(efile and certified) by COC on 9/12/18--ma

cases #14CF203,#14CF239,#14CF319,#14CF323,#14CM163 called at 9:35am. [MK]
Defendant Sean J. Mueller in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court voices its expectations for conduct by the public in the courtroom gallery. The Court clarifies that a member of the media has the Court's permission to take photographs during the hearing. 
Both parties acknowledge receipt of the Pre-Sentence Investigation Report; Attorney Zarwell makes one factual correction to the Report, related to Mr. Mueller's employment history.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Mr. Mueller makes a statement. 


In Case #14CM163 on both Count #1 & #2, the Court sentences Mr. Mueller to serve 6 months in Jail (to be served in WSPS) forthwith, concurrent with each other and concurrent to any sentence in being. The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for the total due:  $243 in costs plus $200 DNA surcharge=$443 on each count ($886 total).  

In Case #14CF203 on Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Mueller to 8 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 5 years.  This sentence is concurrent with Case #14CM163, but consecutive to any other sentence in being.   

In Case #14CF203 on Count #4, the Court sentences Mr. Mueller to 6 months in Jail (to be served in WSPS).  This sentence is concurrent to Count #3. The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for the total due:  $243 in costs plus $200 DNA surcharge=$443

In Case #14CF239 the Court sentences Mr. Mueller to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year, concurrent with Case #14CM163 but consecutive to Case #14CF203. 

In Case #14CF319 the Court sentences Mr. Mueller to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is concurrent to Case #14CM163, but consecutive to Cases #14CF203 and #14CF239.  

In Case #14CF323 on both Counts #1 & #3, the Court sentences Mr. Mueller to  2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent to each other and to Case #14CM163, but consecutive to Cases #14CF203, #14CF239, #14CF319.

The Court finds that Mr. Mueller is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Mueller is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
In Case #14CM163, the Court gives 37 days credit for time already served.
In Case #14CF203, the Court gives 177 days credit for time already served (which includes the 37 days credit also applied to the concurrent terms in Case #14CM163).
In Case #14CF239, the Court gives 0  days credit for time already served.
In Case #14CF319, the Court gives  0 days credit for time already served.
In Case #14CF323, the Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

In Cases #14CF203 (Count #3 only), #14CF239, #14CF319, #14CF323 the Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no contact with any of the Teipner Family Members or the Schoeffling Family members unless authorized by the Agent and specific family members
--no direct or indirect contact with Lars Wallace, Morgan Purucker or Noah Hartwig 
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by the Agent, and except for incidental contact at employment or educational programs as approved by the Agent 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--to undergo anger management counseling until successfully discharged;  this may be waived by the Agent if already completed during the Initial Term of Confinement
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing as deemed appropriate by the Agent 
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--in the felony cases only: to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--in case #14CF203 on Count #3: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in case #14CF239: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in case #14CF319: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in case #14CF323 on Count #1: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in case #14CF323 on Count #3: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties given 
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:49am.
Letters of support submited by the defense
Sentencing hearing on February 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.

cases #14CM163,#14CF203, #14CF239,#14CF319, #14CF323, #14CT177 called at 9:10am. [MK]
Defendant Sean J. Mueller in court, in custody. with Attorney Yelena O. Zarwell.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Zarwell indicates that Mr. Mueller intends to enter changes of pleas, and will request that Branch I keep these cases for sentencing. The Defense will request that sentencing be set on a date after January 6th when Mr. Mueller's Walworth County cases are scheduled for sentencing;  there is a Walworth County PSI pending, and the Defense hopes it can be utitilized in this case. 
The Court confirms that Branch I will keep these cases for sentencing.  The Court will issue its own order for a Pre-Sentence Investigation in these cases due to there being different considerations and victims involved, but the Court will leave it to the Department of Corrections to use the sharing of information as to the investigations involved.

In Cases #14CF319 and Case #14CF323, Mr. Mueller waives his right to Preliminary Hearings; the Court accepts these waivers and binds Mr. Mueller over for trial in each case. 
Service of Informations in cases #14CF319, #14CF323 admitted. 
On Motion of the State, the Court amends the Criminal Complaint and the Information in case #14CF203 Counts #3 and #4 to include the location: the City of Fort Atkinson. 

The charges and maxiumum penalties are recited. Constitutional rights reviewed.  
Pleas entered by Mueller:  
In Case 14CF203: No Contest on Counts #3, #4
in Case #14CF239: No Contest on the single count
in Case #14CF319: No Contest on the single count
in Case #14CF323: No Contest on Counts #1, #3
in Case #14CM163: No Contest on Counts #1, #2

Factual basis stipulated; victim right compliance is not an issue; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Mueller guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered. 

On agreement of the parties, the Court reads in and dismisses all remaining counts [Case #14CF203 Counts #1 & #2; Case #14CF323 Counts #2 & #4], along with the entirety of Case #14CT177.
The Court orders a Pre-Sentencing Investigation; the report is to be filed within sixty days. 
The Court reviews its previous disclosures that it represented Mr. Mueller at a time in the past. The Court indicates that the parties should reflect on this and  notify the Court if either party wants the Court to recuse itself.  

On Motion of the State, the Court revokes bond. 
recess 9:36am. 


NEXT:  (1) PSI Ordered (2) schedule Sentencing on Feburary 9, at 9:30am. (allow one hour)
Status conference on December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

cases #14CF203, #14CF239,#14CM163, #14CT177 called at 8:46am., 
Defendant Sean J. Mueller in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
In case #14CF203, Attorney Zarwell requests adjournment of the Arraignment to allow her further time to confer with Mr. Mueller.
Paula Mueller, mother of Sean Mueller and surety of the $5000 cash bond,  is present in the courtroom; she indicates that she wishes to revoke bond. 
The Court grants the request, and directs that the $5000 posted cash bail amount be returned to Paula Mueller. 
The Court clarifies that the $5000 Cash Bond requirement is now unmet, so in case #14CF203, there is a new requirement for a $5,000 cash bond with the same conditions as previously ordered.  
recess 8:50am, reconvene 8:58am.
In case #14CF239, Mr. Mueller waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. The Court accepts this wavier and binds Mr. Mueller over for trial. 
ADA Shock files the Information in case #14CF239.
recess 9:01am.
[Post-hearing/Off-record, in response to the clerk's inquiry, the Court indicates that the case #14CF203 Bond condition that prohibited contact with Taylor Teipner is striken from the Bond. ]

NEXT:  on or before August 17th, schedule Arraignment in cases #14CF203 & #14CF239, and schedule cases #14CT177 and #14CM163 for Status Conference on same date/time   [and in case #14CF203 only, the 9/2/14 10:15 Bail Forfeiture Hearing regarding the previous $1,000 cash bond remains on the Court's calendar]
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
This $5,000 cash bond amount is separate from the $1,000 cash bond requirement previously posted.

[Clerk: MK]
On State's 7/16/14 Motion to Modify Bond: 
case called at 10:07am. 
Defendant Sean J. Mueller in court with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Arguments given by counsel. 

The Court grants the Motion and modifies the Cash Bond requirement amount from $1,000 to $5,000, with the continued conditions of:  
-To maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Take all prescription medications as prescribed
-No possession of any syringes without demonstrated and documented medical need
-No contact with Taylor Teipner

The Court finds that the previously posted $1,000 cash bond is in default.  
recess 10:11am. 

NEXT:  (1)  Arraignment remains on the Court's calendar for 8/4/14 at 8:30am. (2) schedule Bond Forfeiture Hearing on the original $1000 cash bond that was posted
for Bond Modification, State's

cases #14CF203 and #14CM163 called at 8:42am. 
Defendant Sean J. Mueller in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

In Case #14CF203, Mr. Mueller waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
ADA Shock requests that Arraignment be scheduled on a later date.

As to Case #14CM163, Attorney Zarwell requests that the case "track" the felony case.  
Attorney Zarwell notes that Mr. Mueller has a new case pending, case #14CT177 is scheduled for Initial Appearance in Branch III on July 21st.
Mr. Mueller indicates that he is residing at:  602 Parkwood Lane in Jefferon. 
The Court reminds Mr. Mueller that the bond conditions remain in effect, including that he is prohibited from having contact with Taylor Teipner.
recess 8:46am.

Case called at 3:00 pm
Defendant Sean J. Mueller in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cuase to support Count #1- #4.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Take all prescription medications as prescribed
-No possession of any syringes without demonstrated and documented medical need
-No contact with Taylor Teipner

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
